title: Antibody Purification (small scale)
original description: This protocol described a easy procedure to purify anti-sera in small scale batch. Protein A or protein G beads can be used depending on the immunoglobulin types.
steps:
None
1. Centrifuge anti-sera @ 4ºC,14,000g,10min.   
NOTES This step is to remove  particulates in the serum.
2. (Optional) Filter through 0.2um filter.  
NOTES This step is to remove lipids in the serum.
3. Apply protein A or protein G beads gently to Bio-Rad empty gravity column.  
NOTES anti-sera:beads slurry=1:1(v/v)
4. Set up the column on a vacuum manifold. Equilibrate column with 10 volumes of ice cold Binding Buffer.  
NOTES Use vacuum to pack beads tightly. 
NOTES Binding Buffer: 1xPBS
5. Dilute anti-sera with 2 volumes of Binding Buffer.
6. Let diluted anti-sera go through the column by gravity.  
NOTES No vacuum here.
7. Collect flow through and repeat step 6 once.
8. Wash column with 10 bed volumes of ice-cold Binding Buffer.
9. Elute antibody with 5 bed volumes of room temperature Elution Buffer.  
NOTES Elution Buffer: 100mM citric acid,PH3.0 for protein A beads; 100mM Glycine-HCL,PH2.7 for protein G beads.
10. Fill up each collecting tube with 200 μl 1M Tris-HCl (PH9.0).
11. Collect 1ml of flow through in each collecting tube. Save for antibody activity test.  
NOTES The PH9.0 Tris-HCl in the collecting tube will take the PH of flow through to around 7.
12. Re-equilibrate column with 10 bed volumes of Binding Buffer. Store Column at refrigerator for later use.
